author: @sentdex
text: aaaaaaaaaaaaand already deprecated by Google Finance. We need to update the data puller. Here's a quick snippet example using morningstar instead of google or yahoo:  df = web.DataReader("TSLA", 'morningstar', start, end) df.reset_index(inplace=True) df.set_index("Date", inplace=True) df = df.drop("Symbol", axis=1)  See the text based tutorial for a full explanation of all changes: https://pythonprogramming.net/dynamic-data-visualization-application-dash-python-tutorial/

author: @Grepoan
text: This may have been addressed on these comments already; but I had an issue, solved it, and wanted to share:  The `pandas-datareader` installed via `conda install pandas-datareader` (conda-forge default) produced an ImportError "ImportError: cannot import name 'urlencode' from 'pandas.io.common'".  StackOverflow suggested install from the anaconda branch (v0.9), because the conda-forge branch was still v.81. I instead installed via github v0.10.0 ( https://github.com/pydata/pandas-datareader ).  Doing so produced a new (solved) error "NotImplementedError: data_source='google' is not implemented"  In the `pandas-datareader`, they instead suggest to use the Stooq api.  Thus change the web.DataReader call to   df = web.DataReader('TSLA', 'stooq', start, end)  Made the process complete and work smoothly.

author: @matthewchisambi5898
text: Hi to those struggling with deprecated finance information. I used the EURONEXT Financial Stock information from Quandl. https://www.quandl.com/data/EURONEXT-Euronext-Stock-Exchange  To get it to automatically update, you need to concatenate the quandl search ticket with the input. I did it using this code inside the update_graph function:  def update_graph(input_data):     stock = "EURONEXT/" + input_data     df = quandl.get(stock, authtoken=api_key, trim_start="2016-01-01")      return dcc.Graph(          id='example-graph',         figure={             'data': [                 {'x': df.index, 'y': df.Last, 'type': 'line', 'name': stock},             ],             'layout': {                 'title': stock             }         }     ) ***  Then the user just needs to enter in the stock codes e.g. 'ADYEN', 'ALKAL' or 'NIBC'. Full list in link above.   Hope that helps, if you're not familiar with quandl definitely check out sentdex's tutorial series on data analysis.   Thanks for all the videos sentdex.

author: @michael_weaver
text: Hello guys.. the first of all thank you Sentdex for your great work!  Everyone who needs to fetch a data use this:  https://github.com/ranaroussi/fix-yahoo-finance You'll be able to use Yahoo data again. All what it takes is install trough pip " fix_yahoo_finance " then import it and run a function.  Code:  import dash import dash_core_components as dcc import dash_html_components as html from dash.dependencies import Input,Output import pandas_datareader.data as pdr import datetime as dt import fix_yahoo_finance as yf yf.pdr_override()  app = dash.Dash() app.layout = html.Div(children = [     html.H1(children="Hello Dash"),      html.Div(children='''     Symbol to graph:     '''),      dcc.Input(id='input', value='', type='text'),     html.Div(id='output-graph') ])  @app.callback(     Output(component_id='output-graph', component_property='children'),     [Input(component_id='input', component_property='value')] ) def update_graph(input_data):     start = dt.datetime(1999, 1, 1)     end = dt.datetime.now()     df = pdr.get_data_yahoo(input_data, start, end, as_panel=False)      return dcc.Graph(         id="Example-graph",         figure={             'data': [                 {'x': df.index, 'y': df['Adj Close'], 'type': 'line', 'name': input_data},             ],             'layout': {                 'title': input_data             }         }     )  if __name__== '__main__':     app.run_server(debug=True)

author: @nemecsek69
text: If you get annoying runtime warnings such as "RuntimeWarning: numpy.dtype size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility", add this in the very beginning of your code:  import warnings warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", message=".*numpy.*")  It tells to suppress all warning messages coming from numpy (message is a regex). They can be removed safely. The issue is described here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40845304/runtimewarning-numpy-dtype-size-changed-may-indicate-binary-incompatibility

author: @nemecsek69
text: There are some incompatibilities between newest pandas 0.23 and data_reader 0.6.0 because is_list_like has been moved (damned!). As described in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50394873/import-pandas-datareader-gives-importerror-cannot-import-name-is-list-like  the easiest is to add   import pandas as pd pd.core.common.is_list_like = pd.api.types.is_list_like  just before import pandas_datareader.data as web  The issue will be solved in the newer data_reader 0.7.0
